The linear dynamical system in two variables is

$$\begin{array}{c}\partial_t x  = ax  +  b y \\ \partial_t y = c x +  dy\end{array} = \left[\begin{array}{cc}a & b\\c & d\end{array}\right] \left[\begin{array}{c}x\\y\end{array}\right]\ .$$
The matrix abcd can be turned into two values, $\lambda_1$ and $\lambda_2$ such that $x(t) = A e^{\lambda_1 t} + B e^{\lambda_2 t}.
Use the formula for $\lambda$ in the text to find $\lambda_1$ and $\lambda_2$ for each of the following:

1. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}1 & 1\\0 & 2 \end{array}\right]$

2. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}1 & 1\\1 & 2 \end{array}\right]$

3. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}-1 & 1\\0 & -2 \end{array}\right]$

4. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}-1 & 1\\1 & -2 \end{array}\right]$

5. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}-1 & 1\\0 & 2 \end{array}\right]$

6. $\left[\begin{array}{rr}0 & 1\\-1 & -1 \end{array}\right]$
